instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 no power/charging after screen repair
threads.message:
The device was sent to me by a shop that is not 100% certain that it was working when the customer gave it to them but the display was definitely damaged. 

USB-C meter shows 20V and .08 amps for about 15 seconds before dropping to 0 and then goes back to .08 before repeating this sequence. 

So far I have measured these: 

PPBUS_G3H    12.6V    diode value= 0.452
        
PP3V3_G3H    3.3V    0.388
        
PP3V3_S5    0V    0.33
        
L7670    5.13V    0.392
        
L7030    12.45V    0.471
        
L7701    0V    0.154
        
L8100    0V    0.002/1.6ohms
        
L8410    0V    0.796
        
L7210    0V    0.134
        
L7220    0V    0.134
        
L7230    0V    0.13
        
L7400    0V    0.302


I have removed L8100 and PP1V1_S3 appears to be shorted side. Is it safe to inject 1V here or am I looking in the wrong place?

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 no power/charging after screen repair
threads.message:
"PP1V1_S3 appears to be shorted side"
What is the exact value, in ohm scale?

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 no power/charging after screen repair
threads.message: When I removed L8100 it measured 3 ohms. When I replaced the coil I got 5 ohms.

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 no power/charging after screen repair
threads.message: Compare the value with good board.
